revised_title: Continuous and Quasi-Continuous Registration of Diurnal Temperature Curve in the Animal Body
tldr: The author discusses the history and methods of continuous and quasi-continuous registration of the diurnal temperature curve of the animal body, focusing on the importance of thermometry in understanding and diagnosing diseases. The article highlights key researches and observations that contributed to the development of medical thermometry and its applications in studying temperature variations in healthy and diseased individuals.
